nodes.text: Hi. So what's a nice kid like you doing hanging out in a dank, dark, dangerous place like this?
Right now, I'm mostly just exploring. I'm trying to find the places mentioned on the treasure map.
Any luck?
I'm pretty sure I've found the "Dragon's Mouth" and the "Temple" mentioned on the map. I've found several old sea chests, but none of them seem to be the "Dead Man's Chest".
I've made some progress, but there's a long way to go before I can find the pirate treasure.

nodes.message: If Shawn didn't talk to Katie about the map in the Rec Room.

nodes.text: Look what I came across next to the remains of a dead pirate.
It's the missing piece! This is the section that was stolen from my father by Bill Hellmouth.
Then the dead pirate must've been Bill. Guess he got what he deserved.

nodes.message: Used if Shawn showed Katie the map in the Rec Room earlier.

nodes.text: So did that map piece I gave you help you find your way around here?
I thought this place was supposed to be dangerous, but you seem to be right at home down here.
There are a lot of monsters running around here. I've done my best to avoid the poisonous Sea Drats and the Gogs. I've had to run away from the Zombie Pirates.
But you know, it's really beautiful down here - and there's something glorious about facing dangers.

options.text: Offer to Help Katie with Her Treasure Hunt

nodes.text: I'd be happy to help you find your treasure.
I'm sure you would like a share of my treasure, too.
It's not about the treasure, Katie. I'm willing to face Drats, Zombies, and Gogs to help you accomplish your dreams.
Thanks, Shawn. You're a true friend.  I could use some help here. It's a big place.
See if you can find the 'Dead Man's Chest' or anything else of interest. I'll meet you back here later.
I thought we could go together...
When it comes to sneaking around, one person is quieter than two. Besides, this way, we cover more territory.
Guess what I found while exploring? A piece of a pirate's map...
That's it! That's the missing piece! Let me see it.

Okay, so now the map says "Unlock the gate with Captain's Key
Yet first ye must have items three -
The death head gems both green and red
The Tattooed Skull of Captain Dread."
You wear a green gem with a skull on it... Do you suppose that's the 'Death Head Gem" the map talks about?
It could well be... I know my necklace is somehow tied into the treasure.

"On Marlin Spike the Skull will be
Climb down the Mermaid's hair to see
Beyond the wall there's nothing left
But watery grave and certain death."

nodes.name: Spiked Marlin
nodes.description: Katie and I combined the pirate map pieces. I'd better make a copy here in my journal. There's something about climbing down a mermaid's hair to get to a marlin spike to find a skull. I thought pirates were lazy!

nodes.text: Certain death? That doesn't sound very encouraging...

This is a pirate map, remember? They didn't want some random treasure hunter to find their booty.That's why they didn't say something like, "Beyond the wall, it is told, There's coins of silver and of gold."

nodes.name: Katie's Treasure
nodes.description: I've agreed to help Katie find the pirate treasure. I hoped we could do this together, but she wants me to find the Dead Man's Chest on my own and meet her back by the waterfall. Okay, I guess...

nodes.text: While I was exploring, I came across this necklace in the chest bones of a skeleton. Looks kind of familiar...
It's just like my necklace except for color! This has got to important to finding the treasure. Nice one, Shawn!

According to the completed map, we need to find the two Death Head Gems. I think that I may be wearing one of the gems - I was told that my necklace was somehow tied to the treasure. That means that there must be one more skull gem here in the Sea Caves.
You go on the lookout for the Dead Man's Chest, and I'll try to find the missing gem.and anything else we need.
While I was exploring, I came across this necklace in the chest bones of a skeleton. You might find it looks familiar...
It's just like my necklace except for color! Yes! That means that these are the Death Head Gems. Nice one, Shawn!
Wait... you said that this gem was in the skeleton... That must be the Dead Man's Chest! That explains why the various treasure chests stashed around here were worthless.
Guess I really do need your help if I'm going to find the treasure. Glad to have you on board.

options.text: Wish Katie Luck with Her Treasure Hunt

nodes.text: Good luck on your hunt!
Thanks, I'll need all the luck I can get.

nodes.message: TODO: Should Shawn have an option to change his mind and agree to help Katie? Would be sad to lock him out of quest if he clicks the wrong thing.

nodes.text: You and I, alone together in the light of the waterfall with the music of the falling water. It's romantic, don't you think?
Romantic, right. As long as you don't mind the fact that any moment now some Sea Drat or Gog will come along to try to make a meal of us both.
Still, this place is magical in its own way. I do love the sound of the sea. Maybe someday after I find the treasure we can meet again in the Sea Caves. That would be nice.
Take care, beware - try not to let the Gogs get you!
You'd better take care of yourself. Don't get bitten by a poisonous Sea Drat. I'd hate to find your rotting bones lying around here.
You say the most romantic things, Katie.
Ha!

nodes.message: TODO: Add a journal entry with the poem text

nodes.text: Let's see... putting the map pieces together, it now says...

"Unlock the Gate with Captain's Key,
Yet first ye must have items three..."

"The Death Head Gems both green and red,
The Tattooed Skull of Captain Dread,
On Marlin Spike the Skull will be
Climb down the mermaid's hair to see."
So the final line of this map is...

"Beyond the Wall, there's nothing left, 
"But Watery Grave and Certain Death."
Sounds delightful. No mention about treasure...
Yeah, well, there's no mention that this map applies to the Sea Caves of Sardonia, either. It's not like the pirates want strangers finding their treasure.
